svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: Create badges to reflect the number/types of passing eslint rules.
Repeat for each file or file glob you wish to be
Path to which to save the file; defaults to "lint-
badge.svg" in the current working directory
Path to config file for options. Lower priority than
other CLI options. Defaults to non-use.
Path to `package.json` for discovery of its
this defaults to checking `process.cwd()`, but here
will default to not checking for a `package.json`
and just using the regular CLI options. Ignored if
Comma-separated list of specific linting types to
display and/or "nonempty"; defaults to no filter;
Path to module which returns an object map of ESLint
rule IDs to type (whether from the built-in
or a custom type, e.g.,"security"). Empty by
<typeName>=<color> (<color>: CSS-Color|Hex as: ffffff|Hex stroke as s{ffffff})
Color for `mainTemplate` subject. Follow by comma
for additional (e.g., to add a stroke color).
Defaults to determining color by threshold instead.
<typeName>=<color> (<color>: CSS-Color|Hex as: ffffff|Hex stroke as s{ffffff})
Color used when failing a threshold. Follow by comma
for additional (e.g., to add a stroke color).
<typeName>=<color> (<color>: CSS-Color|Hex as: ffffff|Hex stroke as s{ffffff})
Color used when reaching the medium level of a
threshold. Follow by comma for additional (e.g., to
add a stroke color). Defaults to "CCCC00" (a dark
<typeName>=<color> (<color>: CSS-Color|Hex as: ffffff|Hex stroke as s{ffffff})
Color used when passing a threshold. Follow by comma
for additional (e.g., to add a stroke color).
Whether to only create one block of the badge and
not for each linting type. Defaults to `false`.
Threshold at which, a result will use the
`failingColor`). If set to a number, will be checked
against the total of errors and warnings. If set to
a percent, will be checked to the percent of errors
and warnings relative to the total results.
Threshold at which, a non-passing result will use
set to a number, will be checked against the total
of errors and warnings. If set to a percent, will be
checked to the percent of errors and warnings
relative to the total results. Defaults to no
Indicates thresholds for individual type panels. Set
to a single number or percent (to apply to all
types) or to a map of types to thresholds at which,
a result will use the `passingColor` (instead of
list of <key>=<value> pairs where the key is a
linting type (e.g., "suggestion") and the value is a
number or percent.If set to a number, will be
checked against the total of errors and warnings. If
set to a percent, will be checked to the percent of
errors and warnings relative to the total results.
threshold applying to the aggregate panel.
Indicates thresholds for individual type panels. Set
to a single number or percent (to apply to all
types) or to a map of types to thresholds at which,
a result will use the `mediumColor` (instead of
<key>=<value> pairs where the key is a linting type
(e.g., "suggestion") and the value is a number or
percent. If set to a number, will be checked against
the total of errors and warnings. If set to a
percent, will be checked to the percent of errors
and warnings relative to the total results. Defaults
<typeName>=<color> (<color>: CSS-Color|Hex as: ffffff|Hex stroke as s{ffffff})
Key-value set for mapping a linting type name to
color. Reuse for different types. Follow by comma
for additional (e.g., to add a stroke color).
Defaults to not being used and colors being
determined by pass-fail colors and thresholds.
Template for text of lint badge; defaults to:
If present, should be an ES6-template-as-string and
each failing rule ID. Defaults to not being used.
Remember to escape `$` with backslash for CLI use.
(1-based) for each rule ID that is missing. Defaults
